thread.title: Philly charter school gets 9,190 applications for 96 spots
thread.title_full: Philly charter school gets 9,190 applications for 96 spots

author: The Associated Press
title: Philly charter school gets 9,190 applications for 96 spots
text:
Philly charter school gets 9,190 applications for 96 spots Updated: February 22, 2017 â€” 8:15 AM EST 23 Share The Associated Press 
A Philadelphia charter school has received nearly 9,200 applications for just 96 open slots. 
The lottery to enter the MaST Community Charter School closed Tuesday with 9,190 applications. The K-12 school is known for its award-winning math and science programs. 
The only requirement to win a slot in the school for next year is to be a Philadelphia resident, and a little luck. 
The school is located in the city's Somerton section. 
A second MaST school is located in the city's Lawncrest section. It's only K-3 grade. The lottery for that school is on March 7. More Coverage
